revision.text:
{{about|the Canadian comedian|the American director|Kathryn Ryan}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox comedian <!-- for individuals - see Template:Infobox comedian for usage --> | name = Katherine Ryan | image = Katherine Ryan 2014.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Ryan in 2014 | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1983|6|30}} | birth_place = [[Sarnia]], [[Ontario]], Canada | death_date = | death_place = | medium = | nationality = Canadian | active = | children = 1 | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | notable_work = | signature = | website = {{Official URL}} | footnotes = | module = }} '''Katherine Ryan''' (born 30 June 1983) is a Canadian-Irish comedian, writer, presenter and actress, based in the United Kingdom.<ref name="BTJ713">{{cite web|url=http://www.beyondthejoke.co.uk/content/713/new-interview-katherine-ryan|title=New Interview: Katherine Ryan|work=Beyond The Joke}}</ref> She has appeared on British [[panel show]]s including ''[[Mock the Week]]'', ''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]'', ''[[A League of Their Own (UK game show)|A League of Their Own]]'', ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'', ''[[Would I Lie to You? (TV series)|Would I Lie to You?]]'', ''[[QI]]'', ''[[Just a Minute]], [[Safeword (game show)|Safeword]]'', and ''[[Have I Got News for You]]''. In 2015, she replaced [[Steve Jones (presenter)|Steve Jones]] as the presenter of ''[[Hair (TV series)|Hair]]'' on [[BBC Two]]. As an actress, she has appeared in the [[Channel 4]] sitcom ''[[Campus (TV series)|Campus]]'',<ref>{{cite web|first=Louisa |last=Mellor |url=http://www.denofgeek.com/tv/10360/campus-episode-2-review-the-culling-fields |title=Campus episode 2 review: The Culling Fields |publisher=Den of Geek |date=12 April 2011 |accessdate=10 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2011/06/29/13552/channel_4_goes_off_campus |title=Channel 4 goes off Campus : News 2011 |work=Chortle |date=29 June 2011 |accessdate=10 December 2012}}</ref> [[BBC Two]] sitcom ''[[Episodes (TV series)|Episodes]]''<ref name="thenews">{{cite web|url=http://www.portsmouth.co.uk/lifestyle/the-guide/arts-and-comedy/slipping-makes-her-smile-1-4744494 |title=Slipping makes her smile – Arts and Comedy |work=[[The News (Portsmouth)|The News]] |date=1 February 2013 |accessdate=1 February 2013}}</ref> and ''Don't Sit in the Front Row'' with [[Jack Dee]].<ref name="thenews" />
As a [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]], Ryan has appeared on the BBC's ''[[Live at the Apollo (TV series)|Live at the Apollo]]'', both as a featured act and as a lead act. For her work, Ryan won the Nivea [[Funny Women]] Award, and was also runner-up in the Amused Moose Laugh-Off competition in 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/local/bristol/hi/things_to_do/newsid_8660000/8660264.stm |title=Funny Women Awards head to Bath for talent show heat |publisher=BBC News |date=4 May 2010 |accessdate=4 December 2012 }}</ref> In February 2017, [[Netflix]] released ''Katherine Ryan: In Trouble'' which features one of her live stand-up performances on a recent UK tour.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/02/katherine-ryan-doesnt-bite-her-tongue.html |title=Katherine Ryan Doesn't Bite Her Tongue |work=pastemagazine.com |access-date=26 February 2017 }}</ref><ref name=":1" />
==Early life== Ryan's father is a [[draftsman]] and owner of an engineering company, who originally emigrated from Ireland to Canada. Her mother is Canadian and owns an IT Consulting company.<ref name="LonStand9654725">{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/lifestyle/esmagazine/meet-the-queen-of-confessional-comedy-katherine-ryan-9654725.htmlM|title=Meet the queen of confessional comedy: Katherine Ryan|date=7 August 2014|author=Viv Groskop|work=Evening Standard}}</ref> Ryan and her two younger sisters were born and raised in [[Sarnia, Ontario]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/comedy-review-katherine-ryan-1-1503455 |title=Comedy review: Katherine Ryan – News |publisher=Scotsman.com |date=2 March 2011 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> The three siblings spent time in [[Cork (city)|Cork]], Ireland visiting their paternal grandparents.<ref>Was It Something I Said? (Series 1, Episode 4)</ref>
Her parents split up when she was 15. When she was 18 years old, she decided to leave home and chose to study [[city planning]] at the [[University of Toronto]].{{Citation needed|date=February 2017}} While attending university, she worked at [[Hooters]] and then began training other waitresses. She was fired from Hooters for writing on a board "club sandwiches not seals".<ref>{{Citation|last=mistervincenoir|title=The Big Fat Quiz of Everything 2017|date=7 January 2017|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yn2XpuxDBgY|accessdate=23 May 2018}}</ref> In her spare time she undertook [[open mic]] nights as an alternative form of personal entertainment and by graduation had developed a basic comedic routine.<ref name=LonStand9654725/>
==Career== After graduation, Ryan continued working for Hooters as a corporate trainer, travelling around Canada to train other waitresses, and helping to open the only UK branch in [[Nottingham]]. Her partner at the time wanted to explore London, so she agreed to do so for an initial month from summer 2007, moving there permanently from January 2008.<ref name="LonStand9654725" /><ref name="BTJ713" />
=== As a comedian === [[File:Katherine Ryan, Scoundrels, 2012.jpg|thumb|352x352px|Ryan performing stand-up in 2012]] Ryan first appeared on television as herself on [[Channel 4]]'s ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'' in 2012. She had previously appeared in the cast of Channel 4's ''Campus''. On 23 February 2013, she appeared as a celebrity contestant on BBC One's ''[[Let's Dance for Comic Relief]]'' as [[Nicki Minaj]] dancing to "[[Starships (song)|Starships]]". Ryan reached the final, and finished in fourth place. Ryan was later featured on the [[Whitney Cummings]] [[Just for Laughs]] 2013 Gala that was taped before a live audience on 28 July 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.montrealgazette.com/entertainment/festival-central/Just+Laughs+closes+with/8719156/story.html|title=Just for Laughs closes with ... sex|last=Duguay|first=Denise|date=29 July 2013|work=[[Montreal Gazette]]|accessdate=2 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hahaha.com/en/show/whitney-cummings-gala |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130627153641/http://www.hahaha.com/en/show/whitney-cummings-gala |dead-url=yes |archive-date=27 June 2013 |title=Whitney Cummings Gala Press Release |date= |publisher=Hahaha.com |accessdate=2 August 2013 |df= }}</ref> She has since taken new routines to the [[Edinburgh Festival]].<ref name="LonStand9654725" />
In 2015, Ryan replaced [[Steve Jones (presenter)|Steve Jones]] as the presenter of ''[[Hair (TV series)|Hair]]'' on [[BBC Two]]. Also in 2015, Ryan became a panellist for [[Tinie Tempah]]'s team on [[Sky 1]]'s music/comedy panel show ''[[Bring the Noise (game show)|Bring the Noise]]'' and on the [[ITV2]] show, ''[[Safeword (game show)|Safeword]]''.{{Citation needed|date=February 2017}} In 2016, Ryan appeared on series 2 of ''[[Taskmaster (TV series)|Taskmaster]]''. She beat [[Doc Brown (rapper)|Doc Brown]], [[Joe Wilkinson]], [[Richard Osman]] and [[Jon Richardson (comedian)|Jon Richardson]], to win the entire series.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/tv/news/a786517/richard-osman-will-take-on-katherine-ryan-in-taskmasters-second-series/|title=Richard Osman will take on Katherine Ryan in Taskmaster|date=11 March 2016|work=Digital Spy|access-date=26 February 2017|language=en}}</ref>
She also went on a comedy tour in 2016, called Kathbum. In February 2017, [[Netflix]] released ''Katherine Ryan: In Trouble'', featuring one of her stand-up comedy live performances on a recent UK tour.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://decider.com/2017/02/17/katherine-ryan-in-trouble-netflix-review/|title=Cheeky Comedy Doesn't Get Katherine Ryan into Too Much 'Trouble' For Netflix|date=17 February 2017|website=Decider {{!}} Where To Stream Movies & Shows on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Instant, HBO Go|access-date=26 February 2017}}</ref>
She joined [[Jimmy Carr]] in 2017, to host two series of the reboot of ''[[Your Face or Mine?]]''
=== Other work === Ryan wrote a weekly column in the British entertainment magazine ''[[NME]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/author/katherine-ryan|title=Katherine Ryan, Author at NME|website=NME|language=en-US|access-date=26 February 2017}}</ref>
On 6 June 2014, YouTube comedy duo [[Jack and Dean of All Trades|Jack and Dean]] released a [[music video]] for their song "Consent", featuring Ryan in an acting role.<ref>{{Citation|last=Jack and Dean|title=Consent – JACK AND DEAN|date=6 June 2014|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vTxlB_RFrB0|accessdate=26 October 2017}}</ref>
In 2016, Ryan provided the voice of the stuck up white, odd-eyed cat and leader of The Sunshine Circle for Cats Ranceford in [[Disney XD]] and [[Teletoon]]'s animated television series ''[[Counterfeit Cat]]''.
==Personal life== Ryan has a daughter by an ex-boyfriend.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.netflix.com/gb/watch/80134968|title=Katherine Ryan: In Trouble {{!}} Netflix Official Site|website=www.netflix.com|access-date=23 May 2018}}</ref> She has faced two bouts of [[skin cancer]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Oscar |last=Harding |url=http://whatculture.com/tv/exclusive-interview-with-katherine-ryan |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422072752/http://whatculture.com/tv/exclusive-interview-with-katherine-ryan |dead-url=yes |archive-date=22 April 2016 |title=Exclusive interview with Katherine Ryan |publisher=What Culture |accessdate= 26 August 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.readingchronicle.co.uk/whatson/goingout/articles/2013/02/23/86936-comic-katherine-ryan-looks-on-the-bright-side/ |title=Comic Katherine Ryan looks on the bright side |work=[[Reading Chronicle]] | publisher = Berkshire Media Group |date= 23 February 2013 | accessdate = 26 August 2014 }}</ref> She and her daughter live in [[Crouch End]], [[London]].<ref>{{cite news | last1 = Moore-Bridger | first1 = Benedict | last2 = Groskop | first2 = Viv | title = TV comedian Katherine Ryan gives her cheating boyfriend a star role in new show | date = 7 August 2014 | accessdate = 8 June 2015 | url = https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/tv-comedian-katherine-ryan-gives-her-cheating-boyfriend-a-star-role-in-new-show-9653298.html | work = [[London Evening Standard]] }}</ref> On season 1 episode 6 of Comedy Central's Roast Battle, Katherine announced that she was dating one of the contestants, fellow comedian [[Alex Edelman]]. Later, in UK Tabloid The Sun she said "I don't see him but he's allegedly my boyfriend. We've been on-and-off for three years, so he's in some of my stories and then he's not. But he's definitely the best one I've ever dated."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/living/4154987/stand-up-comic-katherine-ryan-men-dominatrix-cosmetic-surgery/|title=Katherine Ryan chats working in Hooters and not being ashamed of her cosmetic surgery|date=5 August 2017|work=The Sun|access-date=23 May 2018}}</ref> Ryan can speak fluent French. <ref>{{Cite Web|title=Romesh Talks To Katherine Ryan|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IcR3sKZSFBM}}</ref>
